newsitem.title: UK: Co-op case against Regan adjourned until July.
newsitem.headline: Co-op case against Regan adjourned until July.

text.p: A court hearing of the Co-operative Wholesale Society's (CWS) private prosecution against entrepreneur Andrew Regan, due to take place on Wednesday, has been adjourned to July 3, a CWS spokesman said on Tuesday.
"The hearing has been adjourned by mutual agreement," the CWS spokesman told Reuters when asked to confirm the adjournment to the City of London Magistrates Court hearing.

An earlier preliminary hearing of the private case brought by the supermarkets-to-funeral parlours group against Regan -- who in April failed in a 1.2 billion pound ($2 billion) bid attempt for the CWS -- was adjourned to give the defence longer to prepare its case.
The CWS case against Regan, along with his business partner David Lyons, is for allegedly "aiding, abetting, counselling or procuring the theft and for handling stolen property".
Allan Green, a former senior executive with CWS, is accused by his former employer of theft of confidential documents.
Regan and Lyons have said they intend defending the case vigorously. ($ = 0.611 British Pounds)
